the

it'd be

follow a

produce more
> faster, can afford to make more mistakes, and can update their 
scenarios,
> and don't have to worry so much about (re-)numbering - which, as I 
gather,
> is rather painful and time-consuming to do at the moment.

Very painfully to set level numbers for any object.  You can currently 
use only your bracket keys to increase and decrease level numbers.  On 
a 100mhz, this can be annoying getting to certain numbers at times.  
On a 1 ghz, this can be frustrating.  Suppose you have an exp level 12 
character and you want to change that character to experience level 
10.  To do so, you would have to delete the old character, and create 
a new character with the exp level.  I consider this almost 
ridiculiously slow.  Hmm.  If I was pretty good at imagining x and y 
coordinates on a grid, I might be tempted to write a small VB program 
just to allow me to update objects.
